problem.markdown:
The engine plant management have heard of the Toyota production system so they decided to make \(A-\Delta A\) engines per day on days that the engine plant needs \(A-\Delta A\) and \(A+\Delta A\) on days it needs \(A+\Delta A\).
>>What is the average daily cost of inventory per day?<<
= 0
[explanation] There is never any inventory, since they make exactly what they need. [explanation]
>>What is the average daily cost of labor per day?<<
= 41280
[explanation] The labor cost on the days that the plant makes \(A-\Delta A\) engines is 640\(W\). On the days that the plant makes \(A+\Delta A\) engines... 1) It makes \(A\) during regular hours so that cost is 640\(W\) 2) It makes \(\Delta A\) engines during overtine. The time requried is \(\Delta A / A\) days. The labor cost of a full day of overtime should be (8)(120)\(W\). Therefore the labor cost of \(\Delta A/A\) days is 960\(W\)\(\Delta A/A\). 3) So the total labor cost on even days is $640\(W\)+960\(W\)\(\Delta A/A\). 4) The labor on odd days is $38400 5) The average is just $41280 [explanation]
>>What is the total labor cost + inventory per day?<<
= 41280
[explanation] This is just a sum of the previous two parts. [explanation]
problem.p: The engine plant management have heard of the Toyota production system so they decided to make \(A-\Delta A\) engines per day on days that the engine plant needs \(A-\Delta A\) and \(A+\Delta A\) on days it needs \(A+\Delta A\).
problem.label: What is the average daily cost of inventory per day?

div.p: There is never any inventory, since they make exactly what they need.

problem.label: What is the average daily cost of labor per day?

div.p: The labor cost on the days that the plant makes \(A-\Delta A\) engines is 640\(W\).
On the days that the plant makes \(A+\Delta A\) engines...
1) It makes \(A\) during regular hours so that cost is 640\(W\)

2) It makes \(\Delta A\) engines during overtine. The time requried is \(\Delta A / A\) days. The labor cost of a full day of overtime should be (8)(120)\(W\). Therefore the labor cost of \(\Delta A/A\) days is 960\(W\)\(\Delta A/A\).
3) So the total labor cost on even days is $640\(W\)+960\(W\)\(\Delta A/A\).
4) The labor on odd days is $38400

problem.label: What is the total labor cost + inventory per day?

div.p: This is just a sum of the previous two parts.
